title: Supreme Court Is Asked to Take Another Ax to Campaign Finance Limits
summary: The case centers on efforts by Republican officials to lift limits on how much money political parties can spend in coordination with candidates.

title: A Key Question for the Supreme Court: What About the Fed?
summary: The president seemed poised for a big Supreme Court win letting him remove officials without cause. But the justices appeared to struggle with how to insulate the Federal Reserve from politics.

title: Supreme Court Questions N.Y. Ban on Religious Exemptions for Vaccines
summary: The U.S. Supreme Court directed a lower court to review the ban, which applies to strict vaccine requirements in New York schools.

title: The Business Strategy That Could Drive Up Your Grocery Bill, and Trump’s $12 Billion Bailout
summary: Plus, a big Hollywood battle just got messier.

title: Trump Insists Tariffs Will Buoy the Economy and Ease Cost Concerns
summary: The president rolled out a $12 billion bailout for farmers as he makes the case that his policy is working — or will soon.

title: Same Product, Same Store, but on Instacart, Prices Might Differ
summary: The findings are the latest example of how the notion of a single price is breaking down in the digital age, a trend economists say could be pushing up some prices.

title: A Frustrated Congress Pushes the Pentagon to Produce Its Boat Strike Orders
summary: In a sign of bipartisan frustration with the Defense Department, the final defense policy bill aims to compel the Pentagon to share execute orders and video documentation.

title: Massachusetts Church Keeps Anti-ICE Nativity Scene, Defying Diocese Leaders
summary: The Christmas display, which replaces Jesus, Mary and Joseph with a sign saying “ICE Was Here,” has drawn criticism from Catholic leaders and immigration officials.

title: Kamala Harris on ’107 Days,’ 2028 and the Democratic Party’s Future
summary: She was seen for two decades as a future face of the Democratic Party. Is she now suddenly a figure of its past?

title: Top 10 Video Games of 2025
summary: Autobiographical stories and mystery games resonated in a chaotic year.

title: Wrenching Pain, a Severe Infection: An ICE Detainee Is Ordered Released
summary: A judge blamed “deliberate indifference” for the illness of a man held by immigration officials. Across the country, several courts have blasted conditions in U.S. facilities.

title: In Thailand and Cambodia, Taking Shelter (Again) as Fighting Reignites
summary: Hundreds of thousands of people fled a deadly border conflict, the authorities said, some sheltering at a racetrack in Thailand and some near temples in Cambodia.

title: Why Thailand and Cambodia Are Fighting
summary: The latest violence comes months after President Trump helped mediate a cease-fire between the two nations.

title: ‘Alan’s Universe’ Shows What It Might Look Like to Win at YouTube
summary: As Gen Alpha’s attention drifts from TV and movies, video creators like Alan Chikin Chow are eager to fill the void.

title: Another Front in the War in Ukraine: Who Gets to Claim a Famed Artist?
summary: Looking to shake off Moscow’s cultural influences, Kyiv has been seeking to highlight the Ukrainian roots of Kazimir Malevich, a renowned avant-garde painter.

title: Trump Criticizes Zelensky as Ukraine Peace Talks Drag On With European Leaders
summary: Despite pressure from the Trump administration, Mr. Zelensky, after meeting with European leaders who vowed continued support in the war, said Ukraine’s position on territory had not changed.

title: N.Y. Archdiocese Will Negotiate Sex-Abuse Settlement for 1,300 Accusers
summary: The archdiocese will raise at least $300 million to fund the settlement. It has agreed with its accusers on a mediator to conduct negotiations.

title: Three Years After Dobbs, the State Divide Over Abortion Deepens
summary: Some states are enacting legislation to make it harder to get an abortion, while others are passing laws to protect people who provide them.

title: Amy Klobuchar: Trump Should Not Replace A.I. Laws With an Executive Order
summary: “One Rulebook” is not the kind of A.I. regulation this country needs.

title: Late Night Sees Through Trump’s ‘Appease Prize’
summary: “Call me a boomer, but these participation trophies have gone too far,” Stephen Colbert said before presenting himself with the First Annual Stephen Colbert Joke Prize.

title: Honduras Issues Warrant for Juan Orlando Hernández
summary: The attorney general said he had asked Interpol to detain Juan Orlando Hernández, who was freed from a U.S. prison last week.

title: Canada’s Northwest Territories Diamond Mines Are Closing
summary: After decades of growth driven by diamond mining, Canada’s Northwest Territories are facing the closure of three major mines and wondering: What’s next?

title: With Cheap Tickets and Lax Etiquette, a Theater Builds an Older Fan Base
summary: The Hollywood Classic cinema in Seoul is popular in a country where 70-year-olds now outnumber people in their 20s.

title: John Noble Wilford, Times Reporter Who Covered the Moon Landing, Dies at 92
summary: He gave readers a comprehensive and lyrical account of the historic mission in 1969. His science coverage as a Pulitzer-winning journalist and an author took him around the world.
